LukaSwap is a single-page Android application developed by Ali Tagipour.

The purpose of this project is to provide a simple and secure tool for location tracking, map visualization, and process management.

• Developer: Ali Tagipour
• Website / Contact: alitagipour.ir
• Language: Java
• IDE: Android Studio
• Open Source: This project is Public / Open Source, and anyone can use, review, or contribute.

No external server communication occurs without user consent.

To test location in Android Developer Options:

1. Go to Settings → About Phone → Build Number and tap Build Number multiple times to enable Developer Mode.
2. Open Settings → Developer Options.
3. Enable Allow Mock Locations.
4. Select LukaSwap as the Mock Location App.
5. You can now test fake locations in the app.

Note: This feature is intended for testing and development only. Do not manipulate real user data.
